oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mt. Zion AME Dickson County: church sign
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mount Zion African Methodist Episcopal Dickson County

Color photograph of Mt. Zion AME Church's sign. The sign reads, "Mount Zion African Methodist Episcopal Church; 3820 Highway 49 East, Charlotte, Tennessee 37036; Pastor Rev. R. E. Corbin." The sign sits in front of the gable-fronted church.

Mount Zion African Methodist Episcopal Church is a rural African American church in Charlotte, Tennessee. The current building consists of concrete blocks and dates to the mid-twentieth century. The presence of older tablet-style tombstones in the church's adjacent cemetery indicates that an earlier building likely stood prior to the concrete-block one. A frame building sits on the same lot and appears to be used by the church. At the time of fieldwork, Reverend R. E. Corbin served as pastor.
